text_blocks.content: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 140 of 236 LC3KMAX4 Parkinson - Direct

(Pause) THE COURT: Apparently, the video is visible on Ms. Drescher's laptop, and I can see folks looking at it. MS. COMEY: The way I'll proceed, your Honor, is I won't ask Ms. Drescher to pause, I'll ask my questions as the video plays, and I will ask Ms. Drescher to please just close down her laptop and press play. All right. We can resume. Thank you. May we pause again, Ms. Drescher, please, at six minutes and 31 seconds. MS. STERNHEIM: Judge, would it be all right if I just move so I can watch the screen? THE COURT: Of course. I thought you weren't going to pause. You are -- MS. COMEY: I apologize, your Honor. I paused because I saw Ms. Sternheim raising her hand to you, and I wanted her to be able to speak. MS. STERNHEIM: Sorry. THE COURT: No, no, that's fine. I want you to be able to see. MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, can we please play it at six minutes and 31 seconds. Thank you. Q. Now, at seven minutes and eight seconds, what do we see here? A. Architectural drawings.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear and readable format. There are no visible redactions or damage.
